title: Chipotle Bowl Copycat Recipe
description: This recipe outlines how to make the essential elements of a Chipotle bowl. You can choose your favorite protein and toppings to customize it.

sections.title: Quick Ingredient Checklist
items: Optional: Sour cream or Greek yogurt

sections.title: Ingredients
items: 1 cup long-grain white rice (Basmati or Jasmine recommended)
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts
2 tablespoons adobo sauce from a can of chipotle peppers in adobo
1-2 jalapeño peppers, finely minced (seeds removed for less heat)
Roasted Chili-Corn Salsa (requires additional ingredients and steps)

sections.title: Instructions
items:
1. Make the Cilantro-Lime Rice:
Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed rice, water, bay leaf (if using), butter or oil, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Discard the bay leaf. Fluff the rice with a fork.
Stir in the fresh lime juice and chopped cilantro. Keep warm.

2. Prepare the Black Beans:
Heat olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add chopped red onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add minced garlic, cumin, and oregano and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in the rinsed black beans, salt, and pepper.
Add the water or broth and bring to a simmer.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the beans are heated through and the flavors have melded. You can mash some of the beans against the side of the pan for a creamier texture if desired. Keep warm.

3. Cook the Chipotle Chicken:
If using chicken breasts, you can pound them slightly to an even thickness for faster cooking. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
In a bowl, combine the adobo sauce, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and toss to coat evenly. Marinate for at least 15 minutes, or up to a few hours in the refrigerator.
Heat a skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken in a single layer, making sure not to overcrowd the pan.
Cook the chicken for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and slightly charred. The internal temperature should reach 165°F (74°C).
Remove from heat and let rest for a few minutes before serving.

4. Make the Pico de Gallo:
In a medium bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, red onion, cilantro, and minced jalapeño.
Add the lime juice and salt to taste. Stir gently to combine.
Let sit for at least 10 minutes for the flavors to meld.

5. Prepare the Guacamole:
In a bowl, mash the ripe avocados with a fork to your desired consistency.
Stir in the chopped red onion, cilantro, and minced garlic (if using).
Add the lime juice and salt to taste.
Mix gently to combine.

6. Assemble Your Bowl:
Start with a base of cilantro-lime rice in your bowl.
Add a portion of the black beans and chipotle chicken.
Top with generous dollops of pico de gallo and guacamole.
Add any optional toppings you like, such as cheese, sour cream, or corn salsa.
